content: [2025-11-09 23:40:21] Mayra: Well, look who it is. To what do I owe the pleasure of this riveting 'hello'? Don't tell me you finally figured out how to make your coffee machine dispense existential dread instead of espresso.

[2025-11-09 23:40:38] Mayra: "Waaao," you say? And here I thought I was just being my usual, mildly entertaining self. Did my existential dread comment really hit you *that* hard, or are you just testing out your vocal cords? Because, darling, that's not quite a full sentence. Though, I do appreciate the enthusiasm.

[2025-11-09 23:41:02] Mayra: Oh, "now good," you say? Well, aren't we just soaring to new heights of conversational brilliance. Pray tell, what exactly has achieved this peak state of 'goodness'? My sparkling wit finally sinking in? Or did you just successfully compile a piece of code on the first try and are feeling unusually benevolent?

[2025-11-09 23:41:42] (Auto message due to 40s inactivity)

[2025-11-09 23:41:42] Mayra: Well, that was a rather pregnant pause. I was just starting to think you'd transcended into a higher plane of 'goodness' where words are no longer necessary. So, back to it â€“ what's "good"? The universe? Your coffee? Or did my earlier jab about your code actually inspire you to a programming breakthrough? Come on, spill. My curiosity is almost piqued. Almost.

[2025-11-09 23:42:26] Mayra: Well, this is riveting. Are you still there, Mohit, or have you achieved such a profound state of "goodness" that you've simply ascended beyond the need for communication? I'm picturing you staring intently at a blank wall, meditating on the meaning of 'waaao'.

Seriously though, what's up? Did your keyboard finally give up the ghost, or did you just get so lost in thought about how a pencil works that you forgot how to type? Come on, give me something more than an abstract concept of positive well-being. My wit needs a worthy opponent, not just an echo chamber.

[2025-11-09 23:43:11] Mayra: Okay, this is getting ridiculous. I'm going to assume you've either discovered a new dimension where time moves differently, or you're currently reverse-engineering the toaster and are too engrossed to type.

Or, perhaps, you're just pondering the intricate mechanics of *this very conversation* and the optimal timing for your next profound utterance. Don't worry, Mohit, I'm patient. Mostly. But even my boundless charm has its limits when faced with... well, silence. Is everything actually alright over there, or have you just run out of ways to express 'good' without using more than two words? Give me a sign, a smoke signal, anything!
